title: Provides for the exclusion of certain costs associated with home health care and the formula for calculating state reimbursements to such programs
summary: Provides for the exclusion of certain costs associated with home health care and the formula for calculating state reimbursements to such programs.

       Introduced  by  M. of A. GOTTFRIED, DINOWITZ, SCHIMEL, N. RIVERA, ROSEN-

       AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to  rate  of  payment
         for  home  health  care  programs  using statewide average calculation
         excluding certain costs

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Subdivision 7 of section 3614 of the public health law, as
    2  added by chapter 41 of the  laws  of  1992,  the  opening  paragraph  as
    3  amended  by section 18 of part C of chapter 109 of the laws of 2006, the
    4  second undesignated paragraph as added by chapter 170  of  the  laws  of
    5  1994 and the third undesignated paragraph as added and the closing para-
    6  graph  as  amended by chapter 59 of the laws of 1993, is amended to read
    7  as follows:
    8    7. (A) Notwithstanding any inconsistent  provision  of  law  or  regu-
    9  lation,  for  purposes  of establishing rates of payment by governmental
   10  agencies for certified home health agencies for the period April  first,
   11  nineteen  hundred  ninety-five  through  December thirty-first, nineteen
   12  hundred ninety-five and for rate periods beginning on or  after  January
   13  first,  nineteen hundred ninety-six, the reimbursable base year adminis-
   14  trative and general costs of a provider of services shall not exceed the
   15  statewide average of total reimbursable  base  year  administrative  and
   16  general costs of such providers of services; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT FOR
   17  PURPOSES  OF ESTABLISHING SUCH RATES OF PAYMENT FOR PERIODS ON AND AFTER
   18  APRIL FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE,  SUCH  STATEWIDE  AVERAGE  CALCULATION
   19  SHALL  EXCLUDE  ANY  OTHERWISE  REIMBURSABLE  COSTS, INCLUDING STEP DOWN
   20  COSTS, REPORTED AND ALLOCABLE AS ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL BUT  ATTRIB-
   21  UTABLE  TO  THE  PROVISION AND MANAGEMENT OF PATIENT CARE INCLUDING, BUT
   22  NOT LIMITED TO, COSTS ATTRIBUTABLE  TO:  PATIENT  OUTREACH;  ASSESSMENT;
   23  COORDINATION  AND MANAGEMENT OF SERVICES; TELEPHONE AND OTHER TELEHEALTH

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02399-01-1

       A. 3683                             2

    1  MONITORING AND COMMUNICATION; MEDICAL SUPPLIES; STAFF TRANSPORTATION AND
    2  ESCORT SERVICES; FAMILY  AND/OR  INFORMAL  CAREGIVER  SUPPORT  SERVICES;
    3  PATIENT  RECORDKEEPING;  AND  TECHNOLOGY  INVESTMENTS  FOR PATIENT CARE.
    4  SUCH  EXCLUDED  COSTS  SHALL  BE  CONVEYED BY THE PROVIDER AS A SEPARATE
    5  DOCUMENT OF SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION ATTACHED  TO  THE  PROVIDER'S  COST
    6  REPORT,  AS  SUBMITTED TO THE DEPARTMENT. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL PROVIDE A
    7  RATE COMPUTATION  SHEET  TO  EACH  CERTIFIED  HOME  HEALTH  AGENCY  WITH
    8  DISTINCT LINES FOR EACH SERVICE AND RATE WHICH SHALL INCLUDE:
    9    (I) THE RATE PRIOR TO THE APPLICATION OF THE ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENER-
   10  AL COST LIMITATION PROVIDED FOR IN THIS SUBDIVISION;
   11    (II)  THE PROVIDER'S TOTAL ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL AMOUNT ALLOCABLE
   12  TO THE RATE FOR THE SERVICE;
   13    (III) SUCH TOTAL ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL AMOUNT  EXCLUSIVE  OF  THE
   14  PATIENT CARE RELATED COSTS DESCRIBED IN THIS PARAGRAPH;
   15    (IV) THE ALLOWABLE ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL COST AMOUNT BASED ON THE
   16  LIMITATION PROVIDED FOR IN THIS SECTION CALCULATED TO REFLECT THE EXCLU-
   17  SION OF PATIENT CARE RELATED COSTS DESCRIBED IN THIS PARAGRAPH;
   18    (V)  ANY  ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL COST DISALLOWED TO THE RATE BASED
   19  ON SUCH LIMITATION; AND
   20    (VI) THE ADJUSTED RATE BASED ON THE APPLICATION OF THE  ADMINISTRATIVE
   21  AND GENERAL COST LIMITATION.
   22    The  amount of such reduction in certified home health agency rates of
   23  payments made during the period April first,  nineteen  hundred  ninety-
   24  five  through  March  thirty-first, nineteen hundred ninety-six shall be
   25  adjusted in the nineteen hundred ninety-six rate period  on  a  pro-rata
   26  basis,  if  it  is  determined upon post-audit review by June fifteenth,
   27  nineteen hundred ninety-six and reconciliation that the savings for  the
   28  state  share,  excluding  the  federal  and  local government shares, of
   29  medical assistance payments pursuant to title eleven of article five  of
   30  the social services law based on the limitation of such payment pursuant
   31  to  this  subdivision  is in excess of one million five hundred thousand
   32  dollars or is less than one million five hundred  thousand  dollars  for
   33  payments  made on or before March thirty-first, nineteen hundred ninety-
   34  six to reflect the amount by which such savings  are  in  excess  of  or
   35  lower  than  one million five hundred thousand dollars. For rate periods
   36  on and after January first, two thousand five through  December  thirty-
   37  first,  two  thousand  six, there shall be no such reconciliation of the
   38  amount of savings in excess of or lower than one  million  five  hundred
   39  thousand dollars.
   40    (B)  No  such  limit  shall be applied to a provider of services reim-
   41  bursed on an initial budget basis, or a new provider, excluding  changes
   42  in ownership or changes in name, who begins operations in the year prior
   43  to  the  year  which  is  used  as  a  base year in determining rates of
   44  payment.
   45    (C) For the purposes of this subdivision, reimbursable base year oper-
   46  ational costs shall mean those base  year  operational  costs  remaining
   47  after  application of all other efficiency standards, including, but not
   48  limited to, peer group cost ceilings or guidelines.
   49    (D) The limitation on reimbursement for  provider  administrative  and
   50  general  expenses  provided  by this subdivision shall be expressed as a
   51  percentage reduction for the rate promulgated  by  the  commissioner  to
   52  each certified home health agency and long term home health care program
   53  provider; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT SUCH REDUCTION PERCENTAGE SHALL NOT BE
   54  INCREASED  FOR  ANY PROVIDER AS A CONSEQUENCE OF THE EXCLUSIONS PROVIDED
   55  FOR IN PARAGRAPH (A) OF THIS SUBDIVISION.

   23  SUCH  EXCLUDED  COSTS  SHALL  BE  CONVEYED BY THE PROVIDER AS A SEPARATE
   24  DOCUMENT OF SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION ATTACHED  TO  THE  PROVIDER'S  COST
   25  REPORT,  AS  SUBMITTED TO THE DEPARTMENT. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL PROVIDE A
   26  RATE COMPUTATION  SHEET  TO  EACH  CERTIFIED  HOME  HEALTH  AGENCY  WITH
   27  DISTINCT LINES FOR EACH SERVICE AND RATE WHICH SHALL INCLUDE:

   29  AL COST LIMITATION PROVIDED FOR IN THIS SUBDIVISION;
   30    (II)  THE PROVIDER'S TOTAL ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL AMOUNT ALLOCABLE
   31  TO THE RATE FOR THE SERVICE;
   32    (III) SUCH TOTAL ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL AMOUNT  EXCLUSIVE  OF  THE
   33  PATIENT CARE RELATED COSTS DESCRIBED IN THIS PARAGRAPH;
   34    (IV) THE ALLOWABLE ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL COST AMOUNT BASED ON THE

   37    (V)  ANY  ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL COST DISALLOWED TO THE RATE BASED
   38  ON SUCH LIMITATION; AND
   39    (VI) THE ADJUSTED RATE BASED ON THE APPLICATION OF THE  ADMINISTRATIVE
   40  AND GENERAL COST LIMITATION.
   41    S  3.  Subdivision  7-a  of  section 3614 of the public health law, as
   42  amended by section 89 of part C of chapter 58 of the laws  of  2007  and
   43  the  opening  paragraph as amended by section 46 of part B of chapter 58
   44  of the laws of 2009, is amended to read as follows:
   45    7-a. (A) Notwithstanding any inconsistent provision of  law  or  regu-
   46  lation,  for  the  purposes  of establishing rates of payment by govern-
   47  mental agencies for long term home health care programs for  the  period
   48  April first, two thousand five, through December thirty-first, two thou-
   49  sand  five,  and  for the period January first, two thousand six through
   50  March thirty-first, two thousand seven, and on and  after  April  first,
   51  two thousand seven through March thirty-first, two thousand nine, and on
   52  and after April first, two thousand nine through March thirty-first, two
   53  thousand  eleven,  the reimbursable base year administrative and general
   54  costs of a provider of services shall not exceed the  statewide  average
   55  of total reimbursable base year administrative and general costs of such
   56  providers  of  services;  PROVIDED,  HOWEVER,  THAT  FOR THE PURPOSES OF

   45    S 4. This act shall take effect on the first of April next  succeeding
   46  the  date on which it shall have become law; provided, however, that the
   47  amendments to the opening paragraph of subdivision 7 of section 3614  of

   50  section  64-b  and  subdivision  5-a of section 246 of chapter 81 of the
